reviewText: I am a GREAT BIG FAN of these 1930s - 1940s mystery thriller movies - The Shadow (Kane Richmond, Victor Jory, Rod LaRocque, Richard Derr); Boston Blackie; The Lone Wolf; The Falcon; The Saint (George Sanders & Hugh Sinclair); Charlie Chan (Warner Oland, Sidney Toler, Roland Winters); Mr. Moto (Peter Lorre); Mr. Wong (Boris Karloff); Dick Tracy (Ralph Byrd & Morgan Conway); Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone with Nigel Bruce); Nancy Drew (Bonita Granville with Frankie Thomas); The Thin Man (William Powell & Myrna Loy); Bulldog Drummond (John Howard, John Barrymore & Ray Milland) - Yep, I've got them all (boxed sets where available) and enjoy watching over and over. SBJ
Combining the tadio version with the magazine character makes for a fun movie. Would have been better if they had Walter Gibson write the script.
Great old noir film!!  The shadow always knows!!
It was fun, but not for more than one viewing. The script and acting were not even on the level of Charlie Chan films, never mind the Thin Man series.
Fun. Slow paced. Good filler for an evening.
Probably wouldn't watch another.  To hokie to be enjoyable.

Have only recently discovered "The Shadow", and then found this gem on Prime to watch. It's wonderful, has some comedy but a good mystery that keeps you wrapped up till the end. Lamont, Margo and Shervy are played rather well and the actors seem to enjoy their characters,
It's a classic.
If you like old detective movies, this era of Hollywood is a fun watch.  By modern day standards, not especially suspenseful, but an excellent way to spend an hour and a half relaxing.
One of the best radio shows of its time.
Typical Movie of the times..Thast what makes it so good
So bad no extra comment
Fun movie, Margo Lane was really good!
Good old B&W detective movie.  Very mild by today's standards but enjoyable characters and plot.  Pleasant way to spend an hour.
I love old black and white, but this was just not well written, staged, filmed or acted.
SLOW not one of the best shadow films I have seen from the period
I enjoyed it!!
I like old movies
Gotta like old black and white movies ...  I do and this one is just fine.
it was very funny.
Weak characterization and plot
The picture and sound were poor, it was 1933 vintage but.  The story and acting were good, Sherlock fans will suffer through the bad stuff.

I'm old enough to have heard the series on radio, though they probably weren't first run. I liked The Shadow radio program a lot, but the movie not so much. This Lamont Cranston is a little too powerless and carries the wrong gun. Still it's fun to see the way these stories used to be told in the movies and compare them to the movie storytelling of today. Mercifully short, it's a watch-it-by-yourself movie because if you have someone else in the room you'll probably decide to do something better with your time.

Very enjoyable old B&W movie.  There was a stretch about half way through where the video quality dropped substantially for several minutes, but then recovered.  I suspect it's because at least two copies of the film were spliced together due to a damaged section in one of them.  Audio quality was very good.
I love 30s and 40s B movies. These hour plus films always have great dialogue and interesting characters. This was a fun caper, though predictable.
Great film noire. Simple but engaging plot with great acting.
Classic old style version of The Shadow.  Poor plot with disjointed action, but fun to view.

I'm a big fan of the classic radio drama of The Shadow as well as the books and short stories in the series. This movie was enjoyable even though it was a very light hearted, almost comical take on the character. It completely abandoned the mystical overtones of the original subject matter but I guess the producers were trying to compete with the other popular detective series of the time such as Charlie Chan or The Falcon. If you want to see a Shadow movie truer to the original I would recommend the 1994 Alec Baldwin version.
It's the Shadow. what more can I say?
Need more like this
Good to watch, but not as good as the radio show.
very good
Good, if you like these old movies, as I do.

The movie itself is what you'd expect of a Monogram 1940s comedy mystery . I happen to enjoy those films , so for me the film was enjoyable . But the dvd copy from Nostalgia Family is lacking . The video is ok with the exception of a few glitches but the audio is another thing . About twenty minutes into a 60 minute film you start to get audio dropouts which continue off and on through the last half of the film . Very frustrating .
old style mystery. NIce look back
Great old show, would have rated higher, but there were parts of the show where the audio was bad from the old recording getting transfered to digital.
I like old movies
Great old movie.
LOVE Old Movies!
I just love old movies!!!
a little convoluted unless you happen to have heard the Shadow radio series, then you can keep up - this was a nice old movie.
Good old time mystery
Short mystery, the Shadow is rather lackluster in what he does on screen however.
Love the older black white movies.  This one was fairly cute, strong comedy in mystery.
Actually I liked this and while "The Shadow" doesn't "cloud men's minds" in this film, there at least is a masked "Shadow" character.  Good character interaction and an involving plotline.
It wasn't that good, but was interesting to watch for nostalgia reasons.
Prefer the radio show
They don't make them like that anymore. Mystery, murder, and humor.
I loved the movie. I am a fan of black and white movies.
fun to watch
Five stars of course great fun, great writing and great acting.
Just classic great stuff
loved it
Love the schtick.
Poor sound quality and parts were silent.
stupid & boring.
The Shadow Knows - Just crazy about these old mysteries.  Fun to watch.
good movie.
Boring.
My wife and I wasere really disappointed.  It wasn't anything close to the old classic radio shows nor the recent movie with Alec Baldwin.
Good for a rainy day.
I had trouble with the voice playing.
This could be the first shadow movie.
Delightfully hokey low budget Hollywood. Recognize many of the same faces from other serials and movies from that era.

I love old mystery movies and overall this is a good movie. I like the character of the Shadow but his girlfriend and side kick got in the way all the time and I wished there had been more of the movie without them. After awhile it got to be more slapstick than mystery.

It's a short movie so if you have about an hour to kill it will fill the time up nicely.
The series falls short of portraying the mystique of the Shadow.
I love movies from the late 30's and the forties and this is pretty good.
I loved the Shadow on the radio when I was a kid! (Yes, I'm that old.) The movie is not in the same class, but it was fun if you like old B mystery movies.

This tried far to hard to be something it was not. The character use was poor and all the time I felt like it wanted to be either the Thin Man or Charlie Chan.  This needed to stay as a radio show program.
While Lamont is better on the radio his screen appearances are fun.

I love these old detective movies. It doesn't compare to the best (The Thin Man and The Maltese Falcon, for example), as far as acting, plot or dialog, so I'll only give it 3 stars, but if you like this sort of film, you'll enjoy this one. It's a murder mystery with The Shadow, his fiancee and his taxi driver helping the wise old police chief and the bumbling police inspector. Plenty of laughs.
Entertaining period piece. Especially if you're familiar with The Shadow.

Okay, remember what it is--it's just a bit of confection. Still, it was fun. The characters were entertaining, and by the end of the day, you had an hour (give or take) of entertainment without profanity and where the good guy has a moral backbone.
Although I thought this movie would never end, I enjoyed it.  The Shadow wasn't very scary but for the 1940's not too bad.
fantasticI love this for the sign of the times I thought it was great and it was cute I will buy this dvd.
The story was good, Good plot.  Hard to watch because it kept skipping and pausing.  Not my service, I have FIOS.

An oldy, with older style and techniques. This means some weakness for those of us who are into modern film techniques. But, when these difference are allowed for it is still an interesting movie. Probably a watch once film.

I love old back & white mystery movies.  Cuddling up to that special someone on a rainy day & watching these old gems is great!  Enjoy!
Ciao!

Sherlock Holmes,  Dick Tracy, Nick Charles (The Thin Man) and Simon Templar (The Saint) all started their dective lives on paper then radio and eventually the movies. Some  of these movies became classics : Nick and Nora fighting the bad guys. Holes and Watson foiling Moriaritys plans (hey, Robert Downy- stick to Iron Man movies). The Saints tounge-in-cheek humor and smoothness with the ladies (a possible template for a future James Bond).
And now we come to Lamont Cranston. The Shadow was a staple among fans of radio mysteries. The dark almost menacing voice appealed to young and old alike. As for this film adaptation I find it a disgrace to the genre.
The layout of most of these stories were the same: A murder and or robbery. A wronged suspect, a gunfight, a fistfight. A quick car chase. A sudden plot twist amd Voila the mystery is solved.
The story hes is so poor you cheer for the dead guy. At least he doesn't have to waddle through anothe hour of this poorly written drek.
The acting, though hammy at times, is barely passable.
My biggest complaint is the fact that the film has NOT been retored to it's original format. Scenes come and go without transition. Dialogue gets cut right in the middle of speech. The film copy is grainy and dark in some spots.
HEY AMAZON! CHECK YOUR STOCK. At least VUDU and Netflix warn you about bad copies. If you want to see good copies of old movies check out the listings for Turner Classic Movies.
I give this movie two stars: a B for effort and a D for achievement.
Love a classic movie. This is way better than any of the remakes of the Shadow movies made from the 80s and 90s.
It's nice to go back in time and watch shows that are more sedate, less violent, when entertainment didn't mean watching stuff blow up and people bleed out :(

This is an old-poor attempt. Even in the old comic-books he would be "invisible" to everyone, but in this movie, nearly everyone "sees" him. It's not very good. Okay for an old movie. I watch old movies "just because" I like that they are still "cutting-edge" for their day.

I love this movie era and the old black and white detective films.  This is the first Shadow film I've watched.  Like many films of its time, the plots are similar and the effects were good.  The story is shallow and the acting switch between the Shadow and Lamont Cranston is not well done.  Otherwise, it is enjoyable but, not up to most detective films of its time.

The lead actor, Kane Richmond, did an admirable job as Dick Tracy. He wore the trench coat, but never used a wrist radio to communicate. He also lacked the cutting edge nose of the cartoon character. However, it was a fun low budget "who done it" from the era.
1930s Mystery Detective movies are my favorite, American & British alike. You don`t know who done it until the very end.

The radio shadow was cloaked in hypnosis, while this shadow wears a cloak.  With the aid of his girlfriend and his driver, he removes his cape, and hands it to them to hide.  If you're bored from sitting around the house recovering from surgery, you might be entertained.

If you like plots and dialogue written by a 5th grader, this is the movie for you. This movie must have been rated lower than a B-grade in its era. Totally inane---I could only stomach 10 minutes of it. I like a lot of old movies; Charlie Chan & Mister Wong so I thought this film would be similar...NOT!!!!

Shadow? What Shadow? The whole point of the series which glued children to their radios in its heyday was that Lamont Cranston, a man about town, had learned in the Orient the trick of clouding mens minds so that they could not see him. His invisibility was what gave him special powers. This Lamont Cranston becomes the Shadow by putting on a black coat, hat and mask. There is no indication whatsoever of how or why this gives him special powers, yet in that outfit he is able to fight men much larger than himself and win without mussing his hair. As for story, what story? People run around a cemetery, an old mansion, and a warehouse, while Cranstons chauffeur  he takes Cranston and his girlfriend around in an old taxi  acts the part of Jack Bennys Rochester in whiteface. A total waste of time.
One of the better B/W movies shown or available, a bit talky, but very good. One of the better "Shadow" series.
This is one of the better film noir movies put out,  with a contrived but workable plot line. The film is pristine & that's always a pleasure to watch.
I love the Shadow series, I watched as a kid and am still fascinated by the storyline. Funny, yet satisfies my love of mysteries, without the gore.
Fast shipping, product was just as described.  Thank you
For those of us old enough to remember the Shadow on radio, this was a fun trip down memory lane.
You have to take into consideration of when this was made.  Very enjoyable.
No! Guess I didn't remember about Lamont Cranston.

A fun b-movie mystery that is easy to take. Both the man who plays Lamont Cranston and the actress who plays Margo Lane are better than expected in a low-budget flic from Monogran Pictures, of  Hollywood's poverty row studio that turned out quickies .
Give it try when you need a relaxing, clean and comfortable night's entertainment.

I am a big fan of The Shadow radio program. This movie is not at all like the radio show. Lamont is a big old fop, and no way is this little cupcake Margo Lane (Lois Lane's cousin). I lost count of how many times they did the cutesy "let's get married" BS. The old radio shows are easy to find, you should listen to them instead.
Very creepy and mysterious.
Entertaining movie. Not totally true to the Shadow radio serials but, ok.
A nice old detective movie.
I enjoyed listening to the radio broadcast of the Shadow as a child. It was enjoyable watching the movie of the Shadow.
